verses.kjv: Again there was a day when the sons of God came to present themselves before the LORD, and Satan came also among them to present himself before the LORD.
verses.ct: Once again, a day came when the heavenly beings gathered in the LORD's presence, and Satan also came among them to stand before the LORD.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Satan, From whence comest thou? And Satan answered the LORD, and said, From going to and fro in the earth, and from walking up and down in it.
verses.ct: The LORD asked Satan, "Where have you come from?" Satan replied to the LORD, "From roaming all across the earth, wandering back and forth through it."

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Satan, Hast thou considered my servant Job, that there is none like him in the earth, a perfect and an upright man, one that feareth God, and escheweth evil? and still he holdeth fast his integrity, although thou movedst me against him, to destroy him without cause.
verses.ct: The LORD said to Satan, "Have you noticed my servant Job? There is no one on earth like him — a man of complete integrity, wholeheartedly dedicated to God and turning away from evil. He still holds firmly to his integrity, even though you persuaded me to ruin him for no reason."

verses.kjv: And Satan answered the LORD, and said, Skin for skin, yea, all that a man hath will he give for his life.
verses.ct: Satan answered the LORD, "Skin for skin! A person will give up everything they have to save their own life."

verses.kjv: But put forth thine hand now, and touch his bone and his flesh, and he will curse thee to thy face.
verses.ct: "But reach out your hand and strike his body and his bones, and he will curse you right to your face."

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Satan, Behold, he is in thine hand; but save his life.
verses.ct: The LORD said to Satan, "All right, he is in your power — but you must spare his life."

verses.kjv: So went Satan forth from the presence of the LORD, and smote Job with sore boils from the sole of his foot unto his crown.
verses.ct: So Satan left the LORD's presence and struck Job with painful sores covering his entire body, from the bottom of his feet to the top of his head.

verses.kjv: And he took him a potsherd to scrape himself withal; and he sat down among the ashes.
verses.ct: Job grabbed a broken piece of pottery to scrape his skin, and he sat down in a pile of ashes.

verses.kjv: Then said his wife unto him, Dost thou still retain thine integrity? curse God, and die.
verses.ct: His wife said to him, "Are you still clinging to your integrity? Just curse God and die!"

verses.kjv: But he said unto her, Thou speakest as one of the foolish women speaketh. What? shall we receive good at the hand of God, and shall we not receive evil? In all this did not Job sin with his lips.
verses.ct: But he told her, "You're talking like a foolish woman. Should we accept good things from God but refuse to accept the bad?" Through all of this, Job did not sin with anything he said.

verses.kjv: Now when Job’s three friends heard of all this evil that was come upon him, they came every one from his own place; Eliphaz the Temanite, and Bildad the Shuhite, and Zophar the Naamathite: for they had made an appointment together to come to mourn with him and to comfort him.
verses.ct: When Job's 3 friends learned about all the disasters that had struck him, each one traveled from his home — Eliphaz the Temanite, Bildad the Shuhite, and Zophar the Naamathite. They had arranged to meet together so they could go grieve with him and offer him comfort.

verses.kjv: And when they lifted up their eyes afar off, and knew him not, they lifted up their voice, and wept; and they rent every one his mantle, and sprinkled dust upon their heads toward heaven.
verses.ct: When they spotted him from a distance, they barely recognized him. They burst into loud weeping, and each of them tore his robe and threw dust into the air over their heads toward heaven.

verses.kjv: So they sat down with him upon the ground seven days and seven nights, and none spake a word unto him: for they saw that his grief was very great.
verses.ct: Then they sat on the ground with him for 7 days and 7 nights. Not one of them said a word to him, because they could see that his suffering was overwhelming.
